qas.question: How fast do the observation deck elevators travel?

answers.text: 1,010 metres per minute (61 km/h) in 16 seconds

qas.question: What does cabin pressure control do?

answers.text: help passengers adapt smoothly to pressure changes

qas.question: How fast does the elevator drop down?
At what floor do the doors open on the way down?

context: The high-speed observation deck elevators accelerate to a <a1_0>world-record certified speed<a1_0/> of <a0_0>1,010 metres per minute (61 km/h) in 16 seconds<a0_0/>, and then it slows down for arrival with subtle air pressure sensations. The door opens after 37 seconds from the 5th floor. Special features include aerodynamic car and counterweights, and cabin pressure control to <a2_0>help passengers adapt smoothly to pressure changes<a2_0/>. The downwards journey is completed at a reduced speed of <a3_0>600 meters per minute<a3_0/>, with the doors opening at the <a4_0>52nd<a4_0/> second.
